segment.source: This article shows you how to cast media to remote devices from a Universal Windows app.
segment.target: This article shows you how to cast media to remote devices from a Universal Windows app.

segment.source: Media casting
segment.target: Media casting

segment.source: Media casting
segment.target: Media casting

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: This article shows you how to cast media to remote devices from a Universal Windows app.
segment.target: This article shows you how to cast media to remote devices from a Universal Windows app.

segment.source: Built-in media casting with MediaElement
segment.target: Built-in media casting with MediaElement

segment.source: The simplest way to cast media from a Universal Windows app is to use the built-in casting capability of the MediaElement control.
segment.target: The simplest way to cast media from a Universal Windows app is to use the built-in casting capability of the MediaElement control.

segment.source: To allow the user to open a video file to be played in the MediaElement control, add the following namespaces to your project.
segment.target: To allow the user to open a video file to be played in the MediaElement control, add the following namespaces to your project.

segment.source: BuiltInCastingUsing
segment.target: BuiltInCastingUsing

segment.source: In your app's XAML file, add a MediaElement and set AreTransportControlsEnabled to true.
segment.target: In your app's XAML file, add a MediaElement and set AreTransportControlsEnabled to true.

segment.source: MediaElement
segment.target: MediaElement

segment.source: Add a button to let the user initiate picking a file.
segment.target: Add a button to let the user initiate picking a file.

segment.source: OpenButton
segment.target: OpenButton

segment.source: In the Click event handler for the button, create a new instance of the FileOpenPicker, add video file types to the FileTypeFilter collection, and set the starting location to the user's videos library.
segment.target: In the Click event handler for the button, create a new instance of the FileOpenPicker, add video file types to the FileTypeFilter collection, and set the starting location to the user's videos library.

segment.source: Call PickSingleFileAsync to launch the file picker dialog.
segment.target: Call PickSingleFileAsync to launch the file picker dialog.

segment.source: When this method returns, the result is a StorageFile object representing the video file.
segment.target: When this method returns, the result is a StorageFile object representing the video file.

segment.source: Check to make sure the file isn't null, which it will be if the user cancels the picking operation.
segment.target: Check to make sure the file isn't null, which it will be if the user cancels the picking operation.

segment.source: Call the file's OpenAsync method to get an IRandomAccessStream for the file.
segment.target: Call the file's OpenAsync method to get an IRandomAccessStream for the file.

segment.source: Finally, call the MediaElement object's SetSource method to make the video file the video source for the control.
segment.target: Finally, call the MediaElement object's SetSource method to make the video file the video source for the control.

segment.source: OpenButtonClick
segment.target: OpenButtonClick

segment.source: Once the video is loaded in the MediaElement, the user can simply press the casting button on the transport controls to launch a built-in dialog that allows them to choose a device to which the loaded media will be cast.
segment.target: Once the video is loaded in the MediaElement, the user can simply press the casting button on the transport controls to launch a built-in dialog that allows them to choose a device to which the loaded media will be cast.

segment.source: mediaelement casting button
segment.target: mediaelement casting button

segment.source: Media casting with the CastingDevicePicker
segment.target: Media casting with the CastingDevicePicker

segment.source: A second way to cast media to a device is to use the CastingDevicePicker.
segment.target: A second way to cast media to a device is to use the CastingDevicePicker.

segment.source: To use this class, include the Windows.Media.Casting namespace in your project.
segment.target: To use this class, include the Windows.Media.Casting namespace in your project.

segment.source: CastingNamespace
segment.target: CastingNamespace

segment.source: Declare a member variable for the CastingDevicePicker object.
segment.target: Declare a member variable for the CastingDevicePicker object.

segment.source: DeclareCastingPicker
segment.target: DeclareCastingPicker

segment.source: When you page is initialized, create a new instance of the casting picker and set the Filter to SupportsVideo property to indicate that the casting devices listed by the picker should support video.
segment.target: When you page is initialized, create a new instance of the casting picker and set the Filter to SupportsVideo property to indicate that the casting devices listed by the picker should support video.

segment.source: Register a handler for the CastingDeviceSelected event, which is raised when the user picks a device for casting.
segment.target: Register a handler for the CastingDeviceSelected event, which is raised when the user picks a device for casting.

segment.source: InitCastingPicker
segment.target: InitCastingPicker

segment.source: In your XAML file, add a button to allow the user to launch the picker.
segment.target: In your XAML file, add a button to allow the user to launch the picker.

segment.source: CastPickerButton
segment.target: CastPickerButton

segment.source: In the Click event handler for the button, call TransformToVisual to get the transform of a UI element relative to another element.
segment.target: In the Click event handler for the button, call TransformToVisual to get the transform of a UI element relative to another element.

segment.source: In this example, the transform is the position of the cast picker button relative to the visual root of the application window.
segment.target: In this example, the transform is the position of the cast picker button relative to the visual root of the application window.

segment.source: Call the Show method of the CastingDevicePicker object to launch the casting picker dialog.
segment.target: Call the Show method of the CastingDevicePicker object to launch the casting picker dialog.

segment.source: Specify the location and dimensions of the cast picker button so that the system can make the dialog fly out from the button that the user pressed.
segment.target: Specify the location and dimensions of the cast picker button so that the system can make the dialog fly out from the button that the user pressed.

segment.source: CastPickerButtonClick
segment.target: CastPickerButtonClick

segment.source: In the CastingDeviceSelected event handler, call the CreateCastingConnection method of the SelectedCastingDevice property of the event args, which represents the casting device selected by the user.
segment.target: In the CastingDeviceSelected event handler, call the CreateCastingConnection method of the SelectedCastingDevice property of the event args, which represents the casting device selected by the user.

segment.source: Register handlers for the ErrorOccurred and StateChanged events.
segment.target: Register handlers for the ErrorOccurred and StateChanged events.

segment.source: Finally, call RequestStartCastingAsync to begin casting, passing in the result of the MediaElement object's GetAsCastingSource method to specify that the media to be cast is the content of the MediaElement.
segment.target: Finally, call RequestStartCastingAsync to begin casting, passing in the result of the MediaElement object's GetAsCastingSource method to specify that the media to be cast is the content of the MediaElement.

segment.source: Note The casting connection must be initiated on the UI thread.
segment.target: Note The casting connection must be initiated on the UI thread.

segment.source: Since the CastingDeviceSelected is not called on the UI thread, you must place these calls inside a call to CoreDispatcher.RunAsync which causes them to be called on the UI thread.
segment.target: Since the CastingDeviceSelected is not called on the UI thread, you must place these calls inside a call to CoreDispatcher.RunAsync which causes them to be called on the UI thread.

segment.source: CastingDeviceSelected
segment.target: CastingDeviceSelected

segment.source: In the ErrorOccurred and StateChanged event handlers, you should update your UI to inform the user of the current casting status.
segment.target: In the ErrorOccurred and StateChanged event handlers, you should update your UI to inform the user of the current casting status.

segment.source: These events are discussed in detail in the following section on creating a custom casting device picker.
segment.target: These events are discussed in detail in the following section on creating a custom casting device picker.

segment.source: EmptyStateHandlers
segment.target: EmptyStateHandlers

segment.source: Media casting with a custom device picker
segment.target: Media casting with a custom device picker

segment.source: The following section describes how to create your own casting device picker UI by enumerating the casting devices and initiating the connection from your code.
segment.target: The following section describes how to create your own casting device picker UI by enumerating the casting devices and initiating the connection from your code.

segment.source: To enumerate the available casting devices, include the Windows.Devices.Enumeration namespace in your project.
segment.target: To enumerate the available casting devices, include the Windows.Devices.Enumeration namespace in your project.

segment.source: EnumerationNamespace
segment.target: EnumerationNamespace

segment.source: Add the following controls to your XAML page to implement the rudimentary UI for this example:
segment.target: Add the following controls to your XAML page to implement the rudimentary UI for this example:

segment.source: A button to start the device watcher that looks for available casting devices.
segment.target: A button to start the device watcher that looks for available casting devices.

segment.source: A ProgressRing control to provide feedback to the user that casting enumeration is ongoing.
segment.target: A ProgressRing control to provide feedback to the user that casting enumeration is ongoing.

segment.source: A ListBox to list the discovered casting devices.
segment.target: A ListBox to list the discovered casting devices.

segment.source: Define an ItemTemplate for the control so that we can assign the casting device objects directly to the control and still display the FriendlyName property.
segment.target: Define an ItemTemplate for the control so that we can assign the casting device objects directly to the control and still display the FriendlyName property.

segment.source: A button to allow the user to disconnect the casting device.
segment.target: A button to allow the user to disconnect the casting device.

segment.source: CustomPickerXAML
segment.target: CustomPickerXAML

segment.source: In your code behind, declare member variables for the DeviceWatcher and the CastingConnection.
segment.target: In your code behind, declare member variables for the DeviceWatcher and the CastingConnection.

segment.source: DeclareDeviceWatcher
segment.target: DeclareDeviceWatcher

segment.source: In the Click handler for the startWatcherButton, first update the UI by disabling the button and making the progress ring active while device enumeration is ongoing.
segment.target: In the Click handler for the startWatcherButton, first update the UI by disabling the button and making the progress ring active while device enumeration is ongoing.

segment.source: Clear the list box of casting devices.
segment.target: Clear the list box of casting devices.

segment.source: Next, create a device watcher by calling DeviceInformation.CreateWatcher.
segment.target: Next, create a device watcher by calling DeviceInformation.CreateWatcher.

segment.source: This method can be used to watch for many different types of devices.
segment.target: This method can be used to watch for many different types of devices.

segment.source: Specify that you want to watch for devices that support video casting by using the device selector string returned by CastingDevice.GetDeviceSelector.
segment.target: Specify that you want to watch for devices that support video casting by using the device selector string returned by CastingDevice.GetDeviceSelector.

segment.source: Finally, register event handlers for the Added, Removed, EnumerationCompleted, and Stopped events.
segment.target: Finally, register event handlers for the Added, Removed, EnumerationCompleted, and Stopped events.

segment.source: StartWatcherButtonClick
segment.target: StartWatcherButtonClick

segment.source: The Added event is raised when a new device is discovered by the watcher.
segment.target: The Added event is raised when a new device is discovered by the watcher.

segment.source: In the handler for this event, create a new CastingDevice object by calling CastingDevice.FromIdAsync and passing in the ID of the discovered casting device, which is contained in the DeviceInformation object passed into the handler.
segment.target: In the handler for this event, create a new CastingDevice object by calling CastingDevice.FromIdAsync and passing in the ID of the discovered casting device, which is contained in the DeviceInformation object passed into the handler.

segment.source: Add the CastingDevice to the casting device ListBox so that the user can select it.
segment.target: Add the CastingDevice to the casting device ListBox so that the user can select it.

segment.source: Because of the ItemTemplate defined in the XAML, the FriendlyName property will be used as the item text for in the list box.
segment.target: Because of the ItemTemplate defined in the XAML, the FriendlyName property will be used as the item text for in the list box.

segment.source: Because this event handler is not called on the UI thread, you must update the UI from within a call to CoreDispatcher.RunAsync.
segment.target: Because this event handler is not called on the UI thread, you must update the UI from within a call to CoreDispatcher.RunAsync.

segment.source: WatcherAdded
segment.target: WatcherAdded

segment.source: The Removed event is raised when the watcher detects that a casting device is no longer present.
segment.target: The Removed event is raised when the watcher detects that a casting device is no longer present.

segment.source: Compare the ID property of the Added object passed into the handler to the ID of each Added in the list box's Items collection.
segment.target: Compare the ID property of the Added object passed into the handler to the ID of each Added in the list box's Items collection.

segment.source: If the ID matches, remove that object from the collection.
segment.target: If the ID matches, remove that object from the collection.

segment.source: Again, because the UI is being updated, this call must be made from within a RunAsync call.
segment.target: Again, because the UI is being updated, this call must be made from within a RunAsync call.

segment.source: WatcherRemoved
segment.target: WatcherRemoved

segment.source: The EnumerationCompleted event is raised when the watcher has finished detecting devices.
segment.target: The EnumerationCompleted event is raised when the watcher has finished detecting devices.

segment.source: In the handler for this event, update the UI to let the user know that device enumeration has completed and stop the device watcher by calling Stop.
segment.target: In the handler for this event, update the UI to let the user know that device enumeration has completed and stop the device watcher by calling Stop.

segment.source: WatcherEnumerationCompleted
segment.target: WatcherEnumerationCompleted

segment.source: The Stopped event is raised when the device watcher has finished stopping.
segment.target: The Stopped event is raised when the device watcher has finished stopping.

segment.source: In the handler for this event, stop the ProgressRing control and reenable the startWatcherButton so that the user can restart the device enumeration process.
segment.target: In the handler for this event, stop the ProgressRing control and reenable the startWatcherButton so that the user can restart the device enumeration process.

segment.source: WatcherStopped
segment.target: WatcherStopped

segment.source: When the user selects one of the casting devices from the list box, the SelectionChanged event is raised.
segment.target: When the user selects one of the casting devices from the list box, the SelectionChanged event is raised.

segment.source: It is within this handler that the casting connection will be created and casting will be started.
segment.target: It is within this handler that the casting connection will be created and casting will be started.

segment.source: First, make sure the device watcher is stopped so that device enumeration doesn't interfere with media casting.
segment.target: First, make sure the device watcher is stopped so that device enumeration doesn't interfere with media casting.

segment.source: Create a casting connection by calling CreateCastingConnection on the CastingDevice object selected by the user.
segment.target: Create a casting connection by calling CreateCastingConnection on the CastingDevice object selected by the user.

segment.source: Add event handlers for the StateChanged and ErrorOccurred events.
segment.target: Add event handlers for the StateChanged and ErrorOccurred events.

segment.source: Start media casting by calling RequestStartCastingAsync, passing in the casting source returned by calling the MediaElement method GetAsCastingSource.
segment.target: Start media casting by calling RequestStartCastingAsync, passing in the casting source returned by calling the MediaElement method GetAsCastingSource.

segment.source: Finally, make the disconnect button visible to allow the user to stop media casting.
segment.target: Finally, make the disconnect button visible to allow the user to stop media casting.

segment.source: SelectionChanged
segment.target: SelectionChanged

segment.source: In the state changed handler, the action you take depends on the new state of the casting connection:
segment.target: In the state changed handler, the action you take depends on the new state of the casting connection:

segment.source: If the state is Connected or Rendering, make sure the ProgressRing control is inactive and the disconnect button is visible.
segment.target: If the state is Connected or Rendering, make sure the ProgressRing control is inactive and the disconnect button is visible.

segment.source: If the state is Disconnected, unselect the current casting device in the list box, make the ProgressRing control inactive, and hide the disconnect button.
segment.target: If the state is Disconnected, unselect the current casting device in the list box, make the ProgressRing control inactive, and hide the disconnect button.

segment.source: If the state is Connecting, make the ProgressRing control active and hide the disconnect button.
segment.target: If the state is Connecting, make the ProgressRing control active and hide the disconnect button.

segment.source: If the state is Disconnecting, make the ProgressRing control active and hide the disconnect button.
segment.target: If the state is Disconnecting, make the ProgressRing control active and hide the disconnect button.

segment.source: StateChanged
segment.target: StateChanged

segment.source: In the handler for the ErrorOccurred event, update your UI to let the user know that a casting error occurred and unselect the current CastingDevice object in the list box.
segment.target: In the handler for the ErrorOccurred event, update your UI to let the user know that a casting error occurred and unselect the current CastingDevice object in the list box.

segment.source: ErrorOccurred
segment.target: ErrorOccurred

segment.source: Finally, implement the handler for the disconnect button.
segment.target: Finally, implement the handler for the disconnect button.

segment.source: Stop media casting and disconnect from the casting device by calling the CastingConnection object's DisconnectAsync method.
segment.target: Stop media casting and disconnect from the casting device by calling the CastingConnection object's DisconnectAsync method.

segment.source: This call must be dispatched to the UI thread by calling CoreDispatcher.RunAsync.
segment.target: This call must be dispatched to the UI thread by calling CoreDispatcher.RunAsync.

segment.source: DisconnectButton
segment.target: DisconnectButton
